clinical_study.brief_title: Health-related Quality of Life in Patients Undergoing Surgery for Pectus Carinatum
clinical_study.official_title: Short and Long-term Effects of Surgical Repair of Pectus Carinatum - A Questionnaire Study of Health-related Quality of Life, Persisten Post-surgical Pain and Sensory Disturbances.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to assess changes in health-related quality of life in patients undergoing surgical correction of pectus carinatum. In addition, the study assessed long-term effects of surgical intervention in relation to the development of persistent postoperative pain and / or sensory disturbances in the surgical field.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in health-related quality of life at 6 months
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (the day before surgery) to six month follow-up (six months after surgery)
primary_outcome.description: Health-related Quality of Life (HRQoL) will be assessed by means of a validated Danish version of the Short-Form 36 Health Survey (SF-36)

secondary_outcome.description: In this study persistent post-surgical pain is defined as pain developing after pectus surgery and lasting for at least 4 months. Other causes of pain (e.g. infection) and pain continuing from a pre-existing pain problem will be excluded.

arm_group.description: Patients who have undergone surgical repair of pectus carinatum.

study_pop.textblock: All patients referred to the Department of Cardiothoracic and Vascular Surgery, Aarhus University Hospital, Skejby for the purpose of surgery for pectus carinatum from May 1, 2012 to May 1, 2013 are invited to participated in the study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all patients undergoing surgery for pectus carinatum
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients without pectus carinatum

facility.name: Aarhus University Hospital, Skejby, Department of Cardiothoracic and Vacular Surgery
